It determines how long we have to wait for the rangefinder to give a reading after we set the STOP_PIN high. For a sonar rangefinder with a range of around 7m this would need to be around 50 milliseconds to allow for the sonar pulse to travel to the target and back again.

param.name: RNGFND4_RMETRIC
param.documentation: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

param.humanName: Distance (in cm) from the fourth range finder to the ground
param.name: RNGFND4_GNDCLEAR
param.documentation: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the fourth range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

param.name: RNGFND4_ADDR
param.documentation: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the LightWare I2C sensor to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses. A value of 0 disables the sensor.

param.name: INS_PRODUCT_ID
param.documentation: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only).

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR2OFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro2 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR2OFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR2OFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR3OFFS_X
param.documentation: Gyro3 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR3OFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYR3OFFS_Z
param.documentation: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCSCAL_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACCOFFS_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACC2SCAL_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer2 scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACC2SCAL_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer2 scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACC2SCAL_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer2 scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACC2OFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer2 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACC2OFFS_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer2 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACC2OFFS_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer2 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACC3SCAL_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer3 scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACC3SCAL_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer3 scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACC3SCAL_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer3 scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

param.name: INS_ACC3OFFS_X
param.documentation: Accelerometer3 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACC3OFFS_Y
param.documentation: Accelerometer3 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_ACC3OFFS_Z
param.documentation: Accelerometer3 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

param.name: INS_GYRO_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.name: INS_ACCEL_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.humanName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE
param.documentation: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE2
param.documentation: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE3
param.documentation: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving
param.name: INS_STILL_THRESH
param.documentation: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5

param.name: INS_GYR_CAL
param.documentation: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

param.name: INS_TRIM_OPTION
param.documentation: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims

values.value: Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

param.name: INS_ACC_BODYFIX
param.documentation: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.humanName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
param.name: AHRS_EKF_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls whether the NavEKF Kalman filter is used for attitude and position estimation and whether fallback to the DCM algorithm is allowed. Note that on copters "disabled" is not available, and will be the same as "enabled - no fallback"

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
param.documentation: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

param.humanName: Duration that shutter is held open
param.name: CAM_DURATION
param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_DIST
param.documentation: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

param.name: CAM_RELAY_ON
param.documentation: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

param.name: CAM_MIN_INTERVAL
param.documentation: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than preset time(ms) ago.

param.name: CAM_MAX_ROLL
param.documentation: Postpone shooting if roll is greater than limit. (0=Disable, will shoot regardless of roll).

param.name: CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN
param.documentation: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection. See also the CAM_FEEDBACK_POL option. If using AUX4 pin on a Pixhawk then a fast capture method is used that allows for the trigger time to be as short as one microsecond.

param.name: CAM_FEEDBACK_POL
param.documentation: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

param.name: MNT_DEFLT_MODE
param.documentation: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Z
param.documentation: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Z
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.name: MNT_STAB_ROLL
param.documentation: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: MNT_LEAD_RLL
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate, compensating for servo delay. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT_LEAD_PTCH
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT_TYPE
param.documentation: Mount Type (None, Servo or MAVLink)

param.name: MNT2_DEFLT_MODE
param.documentation: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

param.humanName: Mount2 roll angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount2 roll angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_Y
param.documentation: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount2 yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_Z
param.documentation: Mount2 yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount2 roll angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount2 roll angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y
param.documentation: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount2 pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z
param.documentation: Mount2 pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.name: MNT2_STAB_ROLL
param.documentation: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Mount2's minimum physical roll angular position

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Mount2's maximum physical roll angular position

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Mount2's minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Mount2's maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Mount2's minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: MOunt2's maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position

param.name: MNT2_LEAD_RLL
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate, compensating for servo delay. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT2_LEAD_PTCH
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT2_TYPE
param.documentation: Mount Type (None, Servo or MAVLink)

param.name: ARMING_REQUIRE
param.documentation: Arming disabled until some requirements are met. If 0, there are no requirements (arm immediately). If 1, require rudder stick or GCS arming before arming motors and send THR_MIN PWM to throttle channel when disarmed. If 2, require rudder stick or GCS arming and send 0 PWM to throttle channel when disarmed. See the ARMING_CHECK_* parameters to see what checks are done before arming. Note, if setting this parameter to 0 a reboot is required to arm the plane. Also note, even with this parameter at 0, if ARMING_CHECK parameter is not also zero the plane may fail to arm throttle at boot due to a pre-arm check failure.

param.name: ARMING_CHECK
param.documentation: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed befor allowing arming. The default is no checks, allowing arming at any time. You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72. For most users it is recommended that you set this to 1 to enable all checks.
param.field: 0:All,1:Barometer,2:Compass,3:GPS lock,4:INS,5:Parameters,6:RC,7:Board voltage,8:Battery Level,9:Airspeed,10:Logging Available,11:Hardware safety switch,12:GPS Configuration

param.name: ARMING_ACCTHRESH
param.documentation: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

param.humanName: Minimum arming voltage on the first battery
param.name: ARMING_MIN_VOLT
param.documentation: The minimum voltage on the first battery to arm, 0 disabes the check

param.humanName: Minimum arming voltage on the second battery
param.name: ARMING_MIN_VOLT2
param.documentation: The minimum voltage on the first battery to arm, 0 disabes the check

param.name: LOG_BACKEND_TYPE
param.documentation: 0 for None, 1 for File, 2 for dataflash mavlink, 3 for both file and dataflash

param.humanName: Maximum DataFlash File Backend buffer size (in kilobytes)
param.name: LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE
param.documentation: The DataFlash_File backend uses a buffer to store data before writing to the block device. Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging. This buffer size may be reduced depending on available memory. PixHawk requires at least 4 kilobytes. Maximum value available here is 64 kilobytes.

param.name: LOG_DISARMED
param.documentation: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled while disarmed. This can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues

param.humanName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay
param.name: LOG_REPLAY
param.documentation: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 state estimator will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost

param.name: BATT_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery voltage sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 13. On the PX4 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 2.

param.name: BATT_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 12. On the PX4 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 3.

param.name: BATT_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick on APM2 or Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX4 using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT_AMP_PERVOLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

param.name: BATT_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT_WATT_MAX
param.documentation: If battery wattage (voltage * current) exceeds this value then the system will reduce max throttle (THR_MAX, TKOFF_THR_MAX and THR_MIN for reverse thrust) to satisfy this limit. This helps limit high current to low C rated batteries regardless of battery voltage. The max throttle will slowly grow back to THR_MAX (or TKOFF_THR_MAX ) and THR_MIN if demanding the current max and under the watt max. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BATT2_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery voltage sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 13. On the PX4 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 2.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. For the 3DR power brick on APM2.5 it should be set to 12. On the PX4 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk powered from the PM connector it should be set to 3.

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick on APM2 or Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX4 using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_PERVOL
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT2_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT2_WATT_MAX
param.documentation: If battery wattage (voltage * current) exceeds this value then the system will reduce max throttle (THR_MAX, TKOFF_THR_MAX and THR_MIN for reverse thrust) to satisfy this limit. This helps limit high current to low C rated batteries regardless of battery voltage. The max throttle will slowly grow back to THR_MAX (or TKOFF_THR_MAX ) and THR_MIN if demanding the current max and under the watt max. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: BRD_PWM_COUNT
param.documentation: Control assigning of FMU pins to PWM output, timer capture and GPIO. All unassigned pins can be used for GPIO

param.name: BRD_SER1_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1) on Pixhawk. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

param.name: BRD_SER2_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2) on Pixhawk and PX4. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.humanName: Enable use of safety arming switch
param.name: BRD_SAFETYENABLE
param.documentation: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

param.name: BRD_SBUS_OUT
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

param.name: BRD_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

param.name: BRD_CAN_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enabling this option on a Pixhawk enables UAVCAN devices. Note that this uses about 25k of memory

param.humanName: Channels to which ignore the safety switch state
param.name: BRD_SAFETY_MASK
param.documentation: A bitmask which controls what channels can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

param.name: BRD_IMU_TARGTEMP
param.documentation: This sets the target IMU temperature for boards with controllable IMU heating units. A value of -1 disables heating.

param.name: BRD_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)

param.name: GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: GPS type

param.name: GPS_TYPE2
param.documentation: GPS type of 2nd GPS

param.name: GPS_NAVFILTER
param.documentation: Navigation filter engine setting

param.name: GPS_AUTO_SWITCH
param.documentation: Automatic switchover to GPS reporting best lock

param.humanName: Minimum Lock Type Accepted for DGPS
param.name: GPS_MIN_DGPS
param.documentation: Sets the minimum type of differential GPS corrections required before allowing to switch into DGPS mode.

param.name: GPS_SBAS_MODE
param.documentation: This sets the SBAS (satellite based augmentation system) mode if available on this GPS. If set to 2 then the SBAS mode is not changed in the GPS. Otherwise the GPS will be reconfigured to enable/disable SBAS. Disabling SBAS may be worthwhile in some parts of the world where an SBAS signal is available but the baseline is too long to be useful.

param.name: GPS_MIN_ELEV
param.documentation: This sets the minimum elevation of satellites above the horizon for them to be used for navigation. Setting this to -100 leaves the minimum elevation set to the GPS modules default.

param.name: GPS_INJECT_TO
param.documentation: The GGS can send raw serial packets to inject data to multiple GPSes.

param.name: GPS_SBP_LOGMASK
param.documentation: Masked with the SBP msg_type field to determine whether SBR1/SBR2 data is logged

param.name: GPS_RAW_DATA
param.documentation: Enable logging of RXM raw data from uBlox which includes carrier phase and pseudo range information. This allows for post processing of dataflash logs for more precise positioning. Note that this requires a raw capable uBlox such as the 6P or 6T.

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the first GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

param.name: GPS_SAVE_CFG
param.documentation: Determines whether the configuration for this GPS should be written to non-volatile memory on the GPS. Currently working for UBlox 6 series and above.

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE2
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the second GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

param.name: GPS_AUTO_CONFIG
param.documentation: Controls if the autopilot should automatically configure the GPS based on the parameters and default settings

param.name: EKF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables EKF1 to be disabled when using alternative algorithms. When disabling it, the alternate EKF2 estimator must be enabled by setting EK2_ENABLED = 1 and flight control algorithms must be set to use the alternative estimator by setting AHRS_EKF_TYPE = 2.

param.humanName: GPS horizontal velocity measurement noise scaler
param.name: EKF_VELNE_NOISE
param.documentation: This is the scaler that is applied to the speed accuracy reported by the receiver to estimate the horizontal velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then a speed accuracy of 1 is assumed. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.humanName: GPS vertical velocity measurement noise scaler
param.name: EKF_VELD_NOISE
param.documentation: This is the scaler that is applied to the speed accuracy reported by the receiver to estimate the vertical velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then a speed accuracy of 1 is assumed. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EKF_POSNE_NOISE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the GPS horizontal position measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EKF_ALT_NOISE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EKF_MAG_NOISE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EKF_EAS_NOISE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EKF_WIND_PNOISE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

param.humanName: Height rate to wind procss noise scaler
param.name: EKF_WIND_PSCALE
param.documentation: Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind speed estimation noiser.

param.name: EKF_GYRO_PNOISE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EKF_ACC_PNOISE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EKF_GBIAS_PNOISE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of gyro bias state error estimates. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EKF_ABIAS_PNOISE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of the vertical acelerometer bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EKF_MAGE_PNOISE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EKF_MAGB_PNOISE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes compass offset estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EKF_VEL_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the GPS velocity measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EKF_POS_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the GPS position measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EKF_GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: This parameter controls use of GPS measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity & 2D position, 1 = use 2D velocity and 2D position, 2 = use 2D position, 3 = use no GPS (optical flow will be used if available)

param.name: EKF_VEL_GATE
param.documentation: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements willbe rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EKF_POS_GATE
param.documentation: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EKF_HGT_GATE
param.documentation: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EKF_MAG_GATE
param.documentation: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EKF_EAS_GATE
param.documentation: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EKF_MAG_CAL
param.documentation: EKF_MAG_CAL = 0 enables calibration based on flying speed and altitude and is the default setting for Plane users. EKF_MAG_CAL = 1 enables calibration based on manoeuvre level and is the default setting for Copter and Rover users. EKF_MAG_CAL = 2 prevents magnetometer calibration regardless of flight condition and is recommended if in-flight magnetometer calibration is unreliable.

param.name: EKF_GLITCH_ACCEL
param.documentation: This parameter controls the maximum amount of difference in horizontal acceleration between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the GPS position data is rejected. If this value is set too low, then valid GPS data will be regularly discarded, and the position accuracy will degrade. If this parameter is set too high, then large GPS glitches will cause large rapid changes in position.

param.name: EKF_GLITCH_RAD
param.documentation: This parameter controls the maximum amount of difference in horizontal position (in m) between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the long term glitch protection logic is activated and the filter states are reset to the new GPS position. Position steps smaller than this value will be temporarily ignored, but will then be accepted and the filter will move to the new position. Position steps larger than this value will be ignored initially, but the filter will then apply an offset to the GPS position measurement.

param.name: EKF_GND_GRADIENT
param.documentation: This parameter sets the RMS terrain gradient percentage assumed by the terrain height estimation. Terrain height can be estimated using optical flow and/or range finder sensor data if fitted. Smaller values cause the terrain height estimate to be slower to respond to changes in measurement. Larger values cause the terrain height estimate to be faster to respond, but also more noisy. Generally this value can be reduced if operating over very flat terrain and increased if operating over uneven terrain.

param.name: EKF_FLOW_NOISE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise and errors in optical flow measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EKF_FLOW_GATE
param.documentation: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the optical flow innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EKF_FLOW_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the optical flow measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

param.name: EKF_RNG_GATE
param.documentation: This parameter sets the number of standard deviations applied to the range finder innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EKF_MAX_FLOW
param.documentation: This parameter sets the magnitude maximum optical flow rate in rad/sec that will be accepted by the filter

param.name: EKF_FALLBACK
param.documentation: This parameter controls the conditions necessary to trigger a fallback to DCM and INAV. A value of 1 will cause fallbacks to occur on loss of GPS and other conditions. A value of 0 will trust the EKF more.

param.name: EKF_ALT_SOURCE
param.documentation: This parameter controls which height sensor is used by the EKF during optical flow navigation (when EKF_GPS_TYPE = 3). A value of will 0 cause it to always use baro altitude. A value of 1 will cause it to use range finder if available.

param.name: EKF_GPS_CHECK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of GPS preflight checks to perform. Set to 0 to bypass all checks. Set to 255 perform all checks. Set to 3 to check just the number of satellites and HDoP. Set to 31 for the most rigorous checks that will still allow checks to pass when the copter is moving, eg launch from a boat.
param.field: 0:NSats,1:HDoP,2:speed error,3:horiz pos error,4:yaw error,5:pos drift,6:vert speed,7:horiz speed

param.name: EK2_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables EKF2. Enabling EKF2 only makes the maths run, it does not mean it will be used for flight control. To use it for flight control set AHRS_EKF_TYPE=2. A reboot or restart will need to be performed after changing the value of EK2_ENABLE for it to take effect.

param.name: EK2_GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls use of GPS measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity & 2D position, 1 = use 2D velocity and 2D position, 2 = use 2D position, 3 = use no GPS (optical flow will be used if available)

param.name: EK2_VELNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set horizontal velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS horizontal velocity measurements.

param.name: EK2_VELD_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set vertical velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS vertical velocity measurements.

param.name: EK2_VEL_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements willbe rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_POSNE_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the GPS horizontal position observation noise. Increasing it reduces the weighting of GPS horizontal position measurements.

param.name: EK2_POS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_GLITCH_RAD
param.documentation: This controls the maximum radial uncertainty in position between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the filter position and velocity states are reset to the GPS. Making this value larger allows the filter to ignore larger GPS glitches but also means that non-GPS errors such as IMU and compass can create a larger error in position before the filter is forced back to the GPS position.

param.name: EK2_GPS_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the GPS measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK2_ALT_SOURCE
param.documentation: This parameter controls the primary height sensor used by the EKF. If the selected option cannot be used, it will default to Baro as the primary height source. Setting 0 will use the baro altitude at all times. Setting 1 uses the range finder and is only available in combination with optical flow navigation (EK2_GPS_TYPE = 3). Setting 2 uses GPS. NOTE - the EK2_RNG_USE_HGT parameter can be used to switch to range-finder when close to the ground.

param.name: EK2_ALT_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors.

param.name: EK2_HGT_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_HGT_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the Height measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

param.name: EK2_MAG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_MAG_CAL
param.documentation: EKF_MAG_CAL = 0 enables calibration when airborne and is the default setting for Plane users. EKF_MAG_CAL = 1 enables calibration when manoeuvreing. EKF_MAG_CAL = 2 prevents magnetometer calibration regardless of flight condition, is recommended if the external magnetic field is varying and is the default for rovers. EKF_MAG_CAL = 3 enables calibration when the first in-air field and yaw reset has completed and is the default for copters. EKF_MAG_CAL = 4 enables calibration all the time. This determines when the filter will use the 3-axis magnetometer fusion model that estimates both earth and body fixed magnetic field states. This model is only suitable for use when the external magnetic field environment is stable.

param.name: EK2_MAG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_EAS_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements used by planes. Increasing it reduces the weighting of airspeed measurements and will make wind speed estimates less noisy and slower to converge. Increasing also increases navigation errors when dead-reckoning without GPS measurements.

param.name: EK2_EAS_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_RNG_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in the range finder measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

param.name: EK2_RNG_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range finder innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_MAX_FLOW
param.documentation: This sets the magnitude maximum optical flow rate in rad/sec that will be accepted by the filter

param.name: EK2_FLOW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise and errors in optical flow measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_FLOW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the optical flow innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_FLOW_DELAY
param.documentation: This is the number of msec that the optical flow measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

param.name: EK2_GYRO_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK2_ACC_P_NSE
param.documentation: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

param.name: EK2_GBIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls growth of the gyro delta angle bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_GSCL_P_NSE
param.documentation: This noise controls the rate of gyro scale factor learning. Increasing it makes rate gyro scale factor estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_ABIAS_P_NSE
param.documentation: This noise controls the growth of the vertical accelerometer delta velocity bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_WIND_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

param.humanName: Height rate to wind procss noise scaler
param.name: EK2_WIND_PSCALE
param.documentation: This controls how much the process noise on the wind states is increased when gaining or losing altitude to take into account changes in wind speed and direction with altitude. Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind velocity estimation noiser.

param.name: EK2_GPS_CHECK
param.documentation: This is a 1 byte bitmap controlling which GPS preflight checks are performed. Set to 0 to bypass all checks. Set to 255 perform all checks. Set to 3 to check just the number of satellites and HDoP. Set to 31 for the most rigorous checks that will still allow checks to pass when the copter is moving, eg launch from a boat.
param.field: 0:NSats,1:HDoP,2:speed error,3:horiz pos error,4:yaw error,5:pos drift,6:vert speed,7:horiz speed

param.name: EK2_IMU_MASK
param.documentation: 1 byte bitmap of IMUs to use in EKF2. A separate instance of EKF2 will be started for each IMU selected. Set to 1 to use the first IMU only (default), set to 2 to use the second IMU only, set to 3 to use the first and second IMU. Additional IMU's can be used up to a maximum of 6 if memory and processing resources permit. There may be insufficient memory and processing resources to run multiple instances. If this occurs EKF2 will fail to start.

param.name: EK2_CHECK_SCALE
param.documentation: This scales the thresholds that are used to check GPS accuracy before it is used by the EKF. A value of 100 is the default. Values greater than 100 increase and values less than 100 reduce the maximum GPS error the EKF will accept. A value of 200 will double the allowable GPS error.

param.name: EK2_NOAID_M_NSE
param.documentation: This sets the amount of position variation that the EKF allows for when operating without external measurements (eg GPS or optical flow). Increasing this parameter makes the EKF attitude estimate less sensitive to vehicle manoeuvres but more sensitive to IMU errors.

param.name: EK2_LOG_MASK
param.documentation: This sets the IMU mask of sensors to do full logging for

param.name: EK2_YAW_M_NSE
param.documentation: This is the RMS value of noise in yaw measurements from the magnetometer. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

param.name: EK2_YAW_I_GATE
param.documentation: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer yaw measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

param.name: EK2_TAU_OUTPUT
param.documentation: Sets the time constant of the output complementary filter/predictor in centi-seconds.

param.name: EK2_MAGE_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_MAGB_P_NSE
param.documentation: This state process noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes magnetometer bias error estimation faster and noisier.

param.name: EK2_RNG_USE_HGT
param.documentation: The range finder will be used as the primary height source when below a specified percentage of the sensor maximum as set by the RNGFND_MAX_CM parameter. Set to -1 to prevent range finder use.

param.name: MIS_TOTAL
param.documentation: The number of mission mission items that has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

param.humanName: Mission Restart when entering Auto mode
param.name: MIS_RESTART
param.documentation: Controls mission starting point when entering Auto mode (either restart from beginning of mission or resume from last command run)

param.name: RSSI_TYPE
param.documentation: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

param.name: RSSI_ANA_PIN
param.documentation: This selects an analog pin where the receiver RSSI voltage will be read.

param.name: RSSI_PIN_LOW
param.documentation: This is the voltage value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Since some radio receivers put out inverted values from what you might otherwise expect, this isn't necessarily a lower value than RSSI_PIN_HIGH.

param.name: RSSI_PIN_HIGH
param.documentation: This is the voltage value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Since some radio receivers put out inverted values from what you might otherwise expect, this isn't necessarily a higher value than RSSI_PIN_LOW.

param.name: RSSI_CHANNEL
param.documentation: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

param.name: RSSI_CHAN_LOW
param.documentation: This is the PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL when the signal strength is the weakest. Since some radio receivers put out inverted values from what you might otherwise expect, this isn't necessarily a lower value than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH.

param.name: RSSI_CHAN_HIGH
param.documentation: This is the PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL when the signal strength is the strongest. Since some radio receivers put out inverted values from what you might otherwise expect, this isn't necessarily a higher value than RSSI_CHAN_LOW.

param.name: NTF_LED_BRIGHT
param.documentation: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the buzzer. Only for Linux and PX4 based boards.

param.name: NTF_LED_OVERRIDE
param.documentation: This sets up the board RGB LED for override by MAVLink. Normal notify LED control is disabled

param.name: BTN_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the button checking module. When this is disabled the parameters for setting button inputs are not visible

param.name: BTN_PIN1
param.documentation: Digital pin number for first button input.

param.name: BTN_PIN2
param.documentation: Digital pin number for second button input.

param.name: BTN_PIN3
param.documentation: Digital pin number for third button input.

param.name: BTN_PIN4
param.documentation: Digital pin number for fourth button input.

param.name: BTN_REPORT_SEND
param.documentation: The duration in seconds that a BUTTON_CHANGE report is repeatedly sent to the GCS regarding a button changing state. Note that the BUTTON_CHANGE message is MAVLink2 only.
